bioghist.p: Ruth Anna Johnson Snowdon, was the wife of Charles Leidy Snowdon Jr., and the mother of Elizabeth Snowdon Hoopes. Snowdon traveled extensively during the 1960s and 1970s.

scopecontent.p: The Ruth J. Snowdon collection of Travel Slides consists of material dating from the 1960s and 1970s. It is a collection of over 7,000 3-D color slides which depict Mrs. Snowdon's worldwide travels to Egypt, Greece, Israel, Haiti, Ceylon, Japan, Italy, Mexico, Bali, Burma, Cambodia, Ceylon, Denmark, Guatemala, India, Java, Jordan, Korea, Qumran, Portugal, Lebanon, Spain, Singapore, Switzerland, Taiwan, Morocco, Philippines, Sicily, Thailand, Yugoslavia, France, and the United States. Each slide is numbered and labeled as to content. An extensive index to the collection includes subject headings and cross-references. Most of the slides are grouped by country, with some series including subheadings, such as cities or regions within a country. Other series include subject groupings such as plants and trees, gardens, children, agriculture, transportation, religion, architecture, or industry. The collection also includes five hand-held 3D slide viewers.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
